settings.title: Our story
settings.description: Combine imagery with text to create stand-out campaign sections, eye-catching promotions, information blocks and more.

settings.title: SAME SHIT, DIFFERENT GENERATION
settings.description: I was born and raised on the east side of O’ahu. All I really did was Surf, Skate, and do Jiu Jitsu back then. To be honest, that’s all I really do now. I met my wife from Kaua’i where we both went to college in Santa Barbara and we decided to move back home to raise our kids so they could grow up the same way we did.

settings.title: A NEW PATH. ONE BAR TO ANOTHER.
settings.description:
I chased my Jiu Jitsu dreams out of college, turning a school project into a martial arts Soap business that I still run today…but somehow, something was still missing. 

Between the frigid west coast point breaks and the warm tropical waves in Hawai’i, one thing remained the same, the sticky stuff beneath my feet, and for whatever reason, a new brand of wax was always something that captivated me. I collected them all - the Australian bars, the super tacky Brazilian formulas, and of course the American classics. 

But about 2 years ago, I decided my growing beanstalk of wax was missing its most important bar - my own.

settings.title: THE SCIENTIST
settings.description:
Meeting the chemist behind the gooey mounds of “Black Mountains” wasn’t easy. Dead ends of no returned emails, manufacturers gone out of business, and sub-par wax samples were plentiful and I almost gave up after 6 months. After all, I wasn’t going to try and cook up my own wax - that simply wasn’t my specialty. 

But before all hope was lost, I met “The Scientist” behind “Black Mountains” - a lifelong surfer from Southern California who’d been cooking up super sticky concoctions for over 20 years and perfecting his craft. Fast forward to today and after running through a handful of test runs, we are proud to present “Batch #1” in the boiling hot summer of 2022.

settings.heading: THE DARK PEAKS BEHIND THE NAME
settings.text:
As I stared at the mountain in the distance, admiring the beauty of the one they call “Black Mountain”, I wondered how long the rain on its summit would take to fall on us. Surfing in heavy rain is the best. 

All of a sudden, shaken from my day dream…“BLACK MOUNTAINS!” my friend yelled. I looked to see dark Himalayas peaking a hundred yards out. B-lining towards the horizon, hoping I might get one before one got me, the name behind the company had just presented itself in the only way it could. 

I can’t live without surfing. I hope you fall in love with these bars like we have. See you amongst the Black Mountains.

Aloha, Chad 

Owner

settings.heading: THE DARK PEAKS BEHIND THE NAME
